website_summaries.verdict: One of the highest speed wireless adapters that is reliable and easy to use.
pros: Connects at up to 1200Mbps and supports Windows XP-10 and Mac OS X 10.6-10.13
cons: The included instructions aren't very detailed
Buyers have some difficulties with Linux

customer_reviews.title: GigaSpeed adapter at regular prices.  Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, Worked perforct right out of the box. 5 Stars. I would buy again from this seller, great price, great deal.
customer_reviews.author: ezsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi adapter is excellent for the money, it gives me a solid and stable connection which has yet to drop once so far. I am able to pull 180MB down using this adapter on Speedtest, which makes me very happy. -Solid build quality -Realtek chipset -Great range/connection -Included USB 3.0 cable -Dual Band All in all this was definitely worth getting, I can safely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Manning

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many things to try and get high-speed WiFi for my gaming PC on the other side of the house. Our home router is 4 walls away from my PC and I've tried using foil behind the router, a 2 WiFi adapters, a WiFi extender and nothing worked. Now, I'm FINALLY getting the internet speed that I pay for at my PC! I also got a Google WiFi router which has also helped with my internet speeds but this router took my internet from about 10-20mbps to 90-100mbps! I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: MissScarIet

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Preface: My modem is on the first floor, I live on the second floor directly above it separated by very thin wood and carpet. Bought this wifi antenna a few months ago, worked fine, but wasn't getting crazy speeds. Subject to disconnects. Loose cord in port. Unbalanced design. Clumsy and annoying software. ~30mb download speed. Under 1mb upload speed. It works, just not very well. Would not recommend. Bought a used Netgear Nighthawk AC 1900 for roughly $10 more. Never disconnects. Seems to be really sturdy. Cool design. Minimal un-intrusive software. Over 200mb download speed. Over 20mb upload speed. Like night and day. Would highly recommend. Don't cheap out on a wifi receiver if you're paying for good internet.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Flores

customer_reviews.title: First impression - plug and play - meets performance expectation
customer_reviews.text: The EDUP links to ATT Arris modem router instantly and was zero fuss plug and play. Apparent response/speed is about twice that of the 300 Mbps Rosewill RNX-N100 that it replaced, Rosewill used with no complaints since 2012. The EDUP does exactly what I expected. If the EDUP provides service for 8-10 years I will remain pleased with the purchase. The computer is also used in Malaysia where it will communicate with a Roseswill RNX-N4PS 300Mbps router on a Huawei modem. I do not expect performance to be improved when used with the old slow router.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schlemmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading my router my old USB Wi-Fi adaptor would not work so I purchase the EDUP USB 3.0 Wireless Adapter. It was very easy to hook up, just plug the included USB cord into it an then into the computer and install the included software. It easily uses the 5G speed on my router. You would think you were directly connected! The only down side is that I have to unplug and re-plug occasionally when the connection is lost. Not sure if that is a problem with my router or not but only takes a second so I haven't checked out yet. Overall it works great and allows me to have my computer everywhere without hard wiring my house!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Hears a lot better than the built-in WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to provide more reliable WiFi reception in the balcony/AV room of our church. It seems to fill the bill. Installation is easy. Unit comes with 3 OS firmware on a thumb drive. Plug it in... Find (in my case) the Windows folder, double click "setup" and it happens in about 1 minute on a 32 GB RAM I7 laptop. Comparing from our home location: With the built in WiFi on my Lenovo 540 laptop, I can "see" 2 other WiFi hotspots in the neighborhood. With this device, I see 8. Quite an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how simple it was to install or how fast the connection is!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a different wifi adapter for my desktop I lost during a move. I bought it not knowing it didn't connect directly to the back (as the picture would lead you to believe) and it connected via an enclosed USB 3.0 cable. No problem: followed the instructions, connected the included flash drive, installed the software, then the adapter and was up and running in under 10 minutes with a strong signal/connection and FAST internet speed. Love it!! Nothing else to say except it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral Tokagi

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, works well for streaming video
customer_reviews.text: Just plug the cable into a USB port and the other end into the adapter. I have a large house and my router is at the other end of the structure in the basement. My desktop streams video with only an occasional bit of interference with Youtube, Netflix and Amazon prime stream seamlessly. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: TeeTwo

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's great but it's not durable at all.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. The one I used for my PC rarely gets moved, but the one I use for my laptop hasn't lasted. They are light plastic and it's really kind of flimsy. Mine stopped working 4 months. If it's for a PC that you aren't going to move, then it's not bad and does a good job. Speed is less than advertised but still pretty good. If you are getting this for a laptop I would look elsewhere. It's just not durable enough to be used on the road much.
customer_reviews.author: James Thom

customer_reviews.title: Good wifi adapter
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I have been happy with my purchase. The antennas are a bit irritating in that when they are moved they have to be retightened frequently. I bought the wireless adapter because the one on my laptop was no longer working. If I move my laptop, sometimes I have to fiddle with the adapter to get it to connect, but that may be in part to my usb ports being a bit worn out. The adapter does what I bought it for, allows me to interact on the internet, so I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: quillinmom

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects too often
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the speed this adapter offers, I was initially quite pleased with my purchase. After some more time with it, I'm growing increasing frustrated with it. It will disconnect usually once or twice a day and require me to unplug and plug back in the cable to get it working again. When it works, it's great but the constant disconnect is definitely a hassle. Spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Met all my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month or ago to alleviate an issue at a cabin/B&B I stay at that has a cruddy internet signal. I've since used this to enhance my internet signal in other hotels and bed and breakfasts that have limited internet signal strength. It works like a charm. The only issue I ran into was that this thing is so small and light that moving the USB cord will move the base, and potentially mis-align the base. Also, you may want to pick up an USB extender cord if your setting up in the middle of a room or don't have a simple line of site.
customer_reviews.author: NICHOLAS SHORKEY

customer_reviews.title: major wifi adapter upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've had this adapter for ~2 weeks and am having great results so far. I'm using it on a 5 year old Asus desktop computer that's been giving me internal wifi adapter fits for a couple years. My connection was constantly dropping and had to be reset, and my signal strength was never better than 25-50mbps. I tried another USB adapter a while back that offered little improvement. Decided to give this EDUP 1200Mbps dual band adapter a try and received immediate and dramatic improvement. My signal has not dropped once since plugging it in and I'm consistently getting 150-250Mbps signal strength. Wish I would've bought this 2 years ago. Very pleased thus far!
customer_reviews.author: theTXbuys

customer_reviews.title: Sorry ! We do not support this operation system
customer_reviews.text: The title is the message I would receive when trying to install the driver. However I learned from the Q&A portion of a different device that if you have Windows 10 (even though one of the drivers if for windows 10) it would automatically install and you just need to put in your Wi-Fi password. A waste of several hours to figure this out, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter, great value, no lag, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: This adapter is great, I was using an onboard wifi adapter on a mac and on a pc to play some games at work and I used to lag all the time, so I figured I would give this adapter a try. It is nice quality, usb3, has dual antennas and was literally plug and play. My speeds are what they are supposed to be and I experience no lag whatsoever. I can't even tell the difference between wi-fi and ethernet now. The price point is also perfect. Just buy this adapter, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Full speed ahead!
customer_reviews.text: Great adapter. Set up was a little complicated in that there are 3 separate drivers to choose from when downloading from the website. Two of them weren't even supported by Windows 10 (or the other way around?). Either way, got it to work and now I have a MUCH faster connection and stronger signal to my router on the other side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: chazkez

customer_reviews.title: Let see how fast is this !!  WTF
customer_reviews.text: Well lets find out about this product ..i made a few test and i was surprise i signed up to 1gig speed to century-link .This test was 50+ feet away from the router possible buying 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Mikehunt

customer_reviews.title: Increased my internet speed 5x
customer_reviews.text: Had a one antenna wifi adapter upstairs and my router is downstairs. My download speed was a slow 8mbs. Installed this double antenna wifi adapter and my speed jumped to 40mbs as measured in Speedtest by Ookla. No more waiting for streaming videos to download. Make sure to use the included USB drive to download and install the software and drivers before attaching the antenna. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: TexAFRet

customer_reviews.title: This device rox. I paid for it and am very pleased - not reduced price
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR - easy set-up, excellent performance. I am an old guy with an old, cheap laptop that I like very well. My laptop does not support 5G wifi (only 2.4G), so I look to supplement. I previously used a product from a different manufacturer which got locked up. I received the EDUP, plugged in the setup thumb drive, cranked it up, and the device found and locked into my 5G right away. I am watching the NCAA football championship game with none of the annoying lags I often experience. I live in Lower Alabama so I know that bandwidth here is being crushed! This is not a paid review or other - PM me if you doubt. Geaux Tigers!
customer_reviews.author: K. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Quick replacement for failing wifi adapter
customer_reviews.text: After the computer was moved to a different floor of our house, the wifi signal from the router was weaker. The older network adapter installed in the computer couldn't keep up. Internet service was often interrupted and even lost. I orderred the EDUP USB 3.0 Wireless Adapter 802.11AC, set it up in a short while, and the problem was solved. No need to even open the computer case! Steady, consistent service to the computer has been restored.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crockett

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It was great when it worked, really. But then there came a point when it started randomly losing its connection with my network, and it seemed the only way to get it to work again was to unplug it and plug it back in, restart my pc, or restart my router. Although it was an easy problem to solve, this process got old very fast. Ended up smashing it to smithereens so that I would quit wasting my time with it and buy an internal chip instead.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy setup.  Fast data connection.  Great reception.
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using a powerline type product to extend the network and have a wired connection, but it was unreliable (random disconnects). Got this to go wireless via USB connection and it has been stable and fast. The setup was easy with the included USB memory stick that held the software and a simple setup and connection of the device was all that was needed. This unit is across the house from the cable modem/router and it gets excellent reception. Gaming/data transfer is much faster than the powerline wired connection was. Bought two (one for a friend) and they work flawlessly and fast. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TroyM

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Troublefree, Good Dollar Value
customer_reviews.text: We installed one adapter with ease. Turned out there was a flash drive with the current drives on it which we installed first. Immediately connected to our Comcast Wi-Fi router. Speed was 50% faster than old, 3yr.old adapter! We have used it for several months with no problems whatsoever. Liked the first one so well, we purchased another adapter for our other office with the same good results.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a difference this made!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a difference this made! I have been using an older USB adapter from Belkin, apparently for way too long! I kept getting connection problems and slow speeds and kept thinking it was because my distance from the WiFi signal but I got this and it picks up a signal like I'm 5 feet from the router, and I'm about 60 feet and through several walls too. Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: T infinity

customer_reviews.title: Improved my wifi signal big time!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved my life 😲My desktop is not that close from our router, and it’s enclosed in like a bunker so my signal was extremely bad. A tech friend advised me to get this and I got it and installed it in the blink of an eye and magically my signal went from spotty/ almost none to 85-90%. Im so happy I got it😄
customer_reviews.author: RomiNation

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after a month of use, best wifi adapter I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've used several other wifi adapters made by TP-Link & Trendnet, and this one is significantly better from my experience so far. Still very strong signal after a month of use. Would definitely recommend getting this over all the others.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaWatson

customer_reviews.title: Awful Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This wifi adapter worked great for about a month. After that, the signal kept dropping, and being intermittent. Turns out the special cable it uses has bent and it now works when it wants to. It is so incredibly weak, I barely moved the wifi adapter during the period it was used. The connection itself is so weak and poorly designed. I don't know why they just couldn't use the proved and tried USB connection. I would say avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Downloading and installing the drivers from the manufacturer's site was quick and easy and connection strength has been solid. My only complaint is a minor one: The unit can't sit flat unless the antenna are in the perfect upright position. It doesn't affect performance as far as I can tell, but it looks pretty bad. It makes me wonder why they're adjustable at all.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a netgear product that gave me, at most, a 90Mbps connection at a distance typical of my situation. With this product I'm now at 240Mbps. The measured signal strength indicator shows no real difference over my old adapter but this product is apparently doing much more with what signal is available. Edit: I discovered that the device is exploiting MIMO, which is great.
customer_reviews.author: ScotA

customer_reviews.title: Good product, lousy installation instructions
customer_reviews.text: I had a LAN CAT5 cable to my PC for a long time, but it suddenly quit working, so I went on Amazon to see about a wireless adapter. The EDUP got good reviews and was fairly priced, so I ordered it. The installation instructions were basically worthless. It bears little resemblance to the actual setup instructions. I ended up using experience and intuition and it was much simpler than the instructions indicated. Nowhere did it say how to use the included usb drive or the separate antennae. Common sense works waaaaay better than the instructions. In spite of the awful installation instructions, the product is working great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Deering

customer_reviews.title: Seller fishing for info (and the wireless adaptor is trash)
customer_reviews.text: When you "win" a wireless extender or towel set ignore it. 99% sure they are fishing for info... I got one, it lasted a couple days then didnt power on... got a second one sent out.... DoA. BUT I "won" the towels on both of them "pfffft". This company is likely a scam, and they are definitely selling trash. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Travis726

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Adapter, EDUP USB 3.0 Wireless Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Wifi Adapter, EDUP USB 3.0 Wireless Adapter 802.11AC 1200Mbps Dual Band with 5G 867Mbps/2.4G 300Mbps Upgrade WiFi on that old laptop or add Wifi to that desktop via USB Network Cable. USB Powered and great signal strength! Reliable, and easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: work as it should have
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a desktop computer that wasn't within reach of a hard wire. I like the fact that I can move the device anywhere on my desk within reach of the cord and it picks up the signal as intended. My son could play WoW and didn't have any problems and my internet pages loaded quickly as a hard wired internet connection
customer_reviews.author: nova73

customer_reviews.title: Plug & Play Ease with a Strong Odor
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to get a MoBo with wifi, so this was an easy solution. Plug & play with Windows 10, although I did DL some of their drivers. Playing WoW on a PC downstairs with the router upstairs. Haven't noticed any lag or speed problems. Device had a strong unpleasant electronic factory smell that overpowered my small PC room for a week before starting to disapate.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Schrup

customer_reviews.title: Fast compared to internal wifi cards in laptops.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use with laptop with internal wifi card. This works like a dream and eliminated the idea of running network cable upstairs to my home office. Would definitely recommend this so that you can utilize the fast speed of your AC1200 router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 3.0 wifi adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade for the newer wifi apdapters! I use to own a old 2.0 adapter and the speed is way different. I think the two antennas really help as well. I am getting about 200mbs. Due make sure to download the driver though that is key for this to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: isaac

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it works
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great adapter, which solved some very, very annoying problems for me. Unfortunately, once in a while it will just quit working. Fortunately, I discovered that if unplug it and re-plug it twice, it starts working again. A small annoyance, but an annoyance nevertheless. Still better than my old internal adapter.
customer_reviews.author: C²

customer_reviews.title: Very weak connection
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a dongle I had. It connected easily and install was super simple. Unfortunately it hasn’t been great at keeping connections. I got it for my desktop that I frequently game on but I’m disconnected at least every hour if not every 30 minutes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day
customer_reviews.text: When my folks moved to be near us and we were scrambling to get them internet options this little gadget was a life saver. While AT&T hooked up the internet my husband popped this little device onto my dad's desktop and he hadinstant internet through the wifi. He's been using it for a month or so now, it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Network Adapter AND Customer Service are FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: WiFi Radio stopped functioning in the friend's laptop and she is very remote from me. So, I needed something that was easy to install and would automatically see the drivers AND had great signal in case it was a signal issue and not the radio. After a lot of research, I found this Long Range Wireless Adapter and had it sent to her. IT IS AMAZING! I AM THINKING OF GETTING ONE FOR MYSELF! She plugged it in and it sees the Apartment Router that is 6 ( six ) blocks away! Thank you, EDUP, for your great customer service and attentiveness!
customer_reviews.author: joseph h long

customer_reviews.title: If you want a real review, READ BELOW
customer_reviews.text: Within one day of using this device, this product has stopped working for me, and for a high range price, it was not working. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Mohepath

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive fix for a tough problem!
customer_reviews.text: This totally solved my problem of inability to get a signal to the motel rooms I stayed in. I was not able to check the gaming capabilities. The wifi where I was using it sucked so it wasn't fast enough to do much, but I was able to get that signal no problem! Great item and cheap fix for what it is made for. 100.00 modem signal spreaders couldn't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kinkead

customer_reviews.title: 1200Mbps Long Range Wifi Adapter for Bigger Room
customer_reviews.text: Transitioning from a ten year old wired/wireless home network with 8 computers ranging from Vista to WIN 10 to a new network. Purchased three different brand adapters and this is the only adapter that worked with the VISTA computer. Installed without any problems and works great. Installed on the old network. Very happy with the outcome of that project. Have just purchased another EDUP WIFI adapter for the new network new computer.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great value, strong signals
customer_reviews.text: Im about 70ft away from router and get a great signal (speed test 240mbps down and 36mbps up) Set up was odd, for me initially it was "plug n play" i just plugged into my pc and was able to connect but came with a flash drive of the drivers so i thought it might be better but it messed with the signal or would disable it, it was weird having it go on and off becauze of the software and sometimes openning the program it would close right away so i just uninstalled the drivers and program and it works without any issues Overall great signal very much worth the money consistent good signal strength for gaming
customer_reviews.author: imorpheus602

customer_reviews.title: Edup wifi adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ever wifi adapter and the picture tells 1000 words, 260 Mbps. Not Bad !!!!!!!!! Wifi Adapter, EDUP USB 3.0 Wireless Adapter 802.11AC 1200Mbps Dual Band with 5G /2.4G. Great speed and I plug and worked without loading any driver, Windows 10 did it automatically. I do recommend this unit highly
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Works Nicely
customer_reviews.text: When we received this I waited until I had time so that I wouldn't feel rushed to get it working. The only issue I have with it is that the directions I received didn't really fit for this wireless wifi. I was able to figure out for myself how to get it to work and I'm grateful for that. For someone less tech savvy it may not be as easy.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Goggin

customer_reviews.title: Instantly worked much better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to add a more sensitive WiFi receiver to my laptop, a 2015 Razer Blade Pro. The onboard adapter would regularly drop the connection to my home router and even when it was working would max out at about 20Mbps (fast.com). The edup EP-AC1605 (two antennae) worked as soon as I plugged it into my USB hub, and gave 120Mbps under identical circumstances. No idea about the long term reliability, but out of the box the device has exceeded all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Easson

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after maybe a month
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this item, I was really excited! It did the job pretty well. It was a lot better than the one I had before. But to my great dismay, it COMPLETELY crapped out on me about a month after working perfectly. It just completely broke. Would't even light up when I plugged it into my other computer. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because it worked well initially.
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline

customer_reviews.title: Strong but inconsistent connection.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to being able to connect to a 5ghz connection with a new wifi adapter, but I've found that the connection is pretty spotty. It'll die randomly, not being able to pick up any other connection and not have an internet connection to the current one it's connected to, and then start back up again. But that makes playing multiplayer games or stream youtube/Netflix very difficult when the connection randomly drops. I was worried before it had something to do with my internal wifi adapter still being active, but now it's disabled and I'm still having this connection issue so I don't know if it's a hardware issue or a software issue. Sad ):
customer_reviews.author: Asia

customer_reviews.title: Quick fix for big problem
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality, fast delivery, and functionality. I teach a business course in a computer lab and the LAN is more unstable than the wireless connection; not to mention the hassle from wires and broken cables. I purchased two and they both saved the day. The floor connections may never get fixed but my students can continue working.
customer_reviews.author: thewassupnetwork

customer_reviews.title: This adapter just works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this adapter for over a year now, and it rocks. I initially used it in our house with thick cement walls, and it grabbed the WiFi signal from the floor below like a champ. I'm now using it to live stream religious services over the church's WiFi and the stream is flawless--no dropped frames during an hour of live broadcast. Next opportunity will be to see how well it works to my garage for an upcoming application. I'm expecting superb results!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: This really worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: When using my laptop's built in wifi in my shop, I was only getting a maximum of 4Mbps transfer of data. With this I got the full 150 Mbps download and 11Mbps uploads that my service provider allows me.
customer_reviews.author: L. F. Lederer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Although I had to install a driver with USB stick I’m more than pleased with installation and operation. I’ve broken two usb WiFi antennas because they connected to the port directly and this can sit on its own away from port.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: great if you like timeouts...worked ok for a month or so now...cant stay connected for $%^t, Had a lil smiley face thank you sticker in the box that said there was a coupon for another one free or some other random piece of crap...no coupon was in my box....disappointed at first but now seems a blessing in disguise?....
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It works well!  Windows 10 compatible...
customer_reviews.text: Our last USB wifi adapter had a tendency of cutting out and didn't work well with Windows 10. This adapter was instantly recognized by Windows 10, updated the driver, and has been working without a skip ever since then. Definitely works better with 5Ghz frequency for speeds...2.4Ghz saw alot lower bandwith which is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Collins

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Might be great for Windows or Mac but it did not work with Linux, as it was advertised. Was not recognized by Linux even after attempting to update the drivers. I gave up after about an hour wasted trying to get it to work. I returned it and got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome - must use driver on USB drive
customer_reviews.text: best wireless adapter I've ever had at this range (I've gone through four!). However, you MUST install the driver provided on the thumb drive that comes with the adapter. And then restart your computer. Then it will work
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael Lacaria

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely the worst! This thing is constantly dropping connection. Anytime I put load on it either downloading a game or streaming a video it drops and must be reset over and over. No drivers work and the thing is just horrid. Do not waste your money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these that I have purchased and they both work great. Just plug it in and it works. The dual antenna make all the difference with great wifi performance even at ranges exceeding 20 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Good at connecting and getting the job done
customer_reviews.text: Good at connecting and getting the job done. But when it comes to speed its good yes BUT there is a catch! Most of the time it will lose connection for a second or 2 tops, yes its not very noticeable when browsing the web. But for gaming you can forget about it, I tried to game online and was about to pull my hair out. This product is worth maybe 10 dollars in my book, Id say go real cheap and small or go all out and big. Skip this trash honestly. Also this is my FIRST amazon review ever, I have bought give or take 200 items on amazon and none as pissed me off this much.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Sundsbarm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm using through a USB 3.0 hub, attached to a desktop. Getting sustained 30MB/s (call it 240ish Mb/s) to an TPI Archer 802.1AC router located on a different floor and about 30 feet away. No problem with recognition or use with Windows 10 Pro. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Need latest driver
customer_reviews.text: I installed the driver on the included flash drive, plugged in the USB WiFi antenna and it worked. I then used the utility 'inSSIDer' to check the signal strength and found that all of the WiFi connections I received were bouncing up and down every 5 seconds between 0 to -255! Looks like it was trying to optimize the connection over and over. I went to Realtek's web site and downloaded the newest Win 10, 64bit, RTL8812BU driver. Fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Technobozo

customer_reviews.title: Not as fast as I'd like...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know... regardless of which USB 3.0 port I use, I cannot seem to get faster than 17-18 mbps out of this. Not sure what's going on. I know for a fact that the WiFi in the room is fine because I am getting 100+ mbps from my phone. Regardless, not worth troubleshooting. It works, but it's just not giving me the performance I need.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was not difficult to install and works like a charm. We actually bought two of these, we have a four-level house, and we have one on the top level, our router is on the second level and the other adapter we bought for another desktop on the third level. The first one we have had for about 6 months, since it worked so well, we wanted to go with something we are familiar with. So we bought another one! Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella M. Love

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Awesomness
customer_reviews.text: My motherboard's built in WiFi is lame. I average 20-25mbs. Pretty lame, with this adapter, I am seeing 80-90mbps. HUGE improvement for little money. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: AEBell

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade over a typical $10 adapter
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using another AC adapter, but I found that in games I had stuttering and I wasn't getting the full internet speed available, after switching to this adapter I went from getting 67 mbps to getting over 100mbps, so this definitely is a solid adapter. Drivers installed automatically on Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Eck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Plug and Play Wi-Fi Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. Went from a standard USB Wi-Fi adapter to this one and am getting speeds similar to an Ethernet connection without any drops. Automatically recognized upon plugging in with Windows 10 Home Premium.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: So Far Love It!
customer_reviews.text: It has worked great for me so far. I really hope it lasts! I will update if there are any issues. Purchased another one for my other computer as well.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: For 2 days I tried to install and get it to connect to the router with no luck. If all I wanted was a hot spot, it would have done the trick. I do not recommend product.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Very fast compared to my old wifi
customer_reviews.text: what a huge difference. My computer is several years old and has had an internal adapter with the two antenna sticking out the back. It was never very fast.. I left that in the computer and just disabled it for now, I'll remove it some other day. But this thing is so much faster. I mean very noticeably faster. money well spent
customer_reviews.author: D.Ayotte

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter because I have an older desktop that I upgraded to the current Windows version. I needed to be able to get online with wifi and this adapter was the tool that allowed me to do so. It was easy installing it and it works as it should!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia T.

customer_reviews.title: hard to establish internet connection
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, but it took 8 or 9 tries to establish an internet connects for the auto-connect. Once finally connected it worked great. very few drops after initial connection. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Anke L.

customer_reviews.title: You can set  your computer any where
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have to put the computer next to the modem and wireless is cool
customer_reviews.author: Julissa Venturi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good value, honestly.
customer_reviews.text: Product comes nicely packaged, and instead of a CD with drivers they send a little 250MB USB drive, which I thought was a really nice touch. If using Windows I would recommend against installing the realtek wifi utility, just install the drivers and you should be fine. The cable is nice and thick, not flimsy like you'd find with most cheap items. I can't say much for long term use but in the short term it seems to suit my immediate needs.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: DEAD AFTER 3 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: This adapter was always "ifeee" from the beginning. Constantly unplugging and plugging back in. Then nothing!!! DEAD...would not even work anymore. Never saw any increase in speed. DISAPPOINTED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JSH

customer_reviews.title: Faster Wifi but internet drops randomly
customer_reviews.text: Hi Sophie, I recieved your email and appreciate you reaching out and asking how the product performed after a month. When it works my internet is much faster than it was with another device. However, about twice a day when I am using this device my internet randomly disconnects and drops completely. I don't know if a replacement would be better or if that is just how the software with this device operates. Thanks, Tim
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J.

customer_reviews.title: Instantly happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Instantly happy with this! My desktop PC is hidden under desk, I know WIFI is slow because of it. It has slowly been getting worse. At best we get 10mb download 3mbs upload. Right now getting 60mb download and still about the same on upload but wow! I'm happy with the download speed improvement!!!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: It works 3/5 times and drops signal randomly
customer_reviews.text: Got this adapter to provide internet for a desktop in my house. Unboxing, setup and configuration was simple and smooth. The adapter worked right away giving out a strong signal being one floor down and about 15ft from my router. Signal was strong for 3 hours straight then all of a sudden began sporadically dropping over and over again. Unfortunately it's been like this since 2-3 hours of connectivity then it will go on a 20min spree of connecting/dropping signal. I thought I found a good solution to my wifi connectivity issues but have now been met with yet another Adapter that promises above board performance but comes in well below what's promised. 3/5
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: I spent about a day trying to figure out which link to download from the seller's website since I have a laptop with no CD drive. Other than a poorly written install instructions, it works pretty well. I'm a floor below and about 30 ft away from our main router and I'm getting about 87% speeds. Mind you my internet provider only gives 20 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: EDUP USB Wireless Adapter
customer_reviews.text: This products works great. It matched the speed that I get when wired. My laptop wireless card was only a g/b/n and this adapter added the option of the ac to connect to the 5ghz. I was amazed and highly recommend this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long, multiple issues.
customer_reviews.text: Was good at the beginning. This item will last you about a year. Mine stopped working for no reason. Gave me a lot of issues throughout the year as well. I expect modern devices to last many years, this one did not.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: I've always wanted one of these. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a nice laptop with terrible wireless reception and no access to faster speed, This solved that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zwoof

customer_reviews.title: Performance ranked after 1 month of use.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first month I had it. Easy to install and no hastle. After a month the connection would always go extremely slow at times. Being a gamer this is a huge problem. Also when connecting the cord to the adapter, I have to put it in at just the right angle for it to actually turn on. God forbid it falls or unplugs cause then I'd have to spend another 10 minutes figuring out how to pit it in at the right angle. Overall I wouldn't reccomend this for long time use. If you use it for a short time it's great but remember it will deteriorate.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Charland

customer_reviews.title: Run Away Screaming
customer_reviews.text: As I wrote this, I had to unplug and re-plug this device several times to re-establish a connection. It started doing this two months after purchase. I'll have to do this for a couple of days while I wait for a replacement. I didn't even consider using any sort of warranty, if there is one, because I don't want another.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: These are crap they are only a G connection
customer_reviews.text: These were completely misrepresented on a 5G 1750 router they only connect at 54 Mbps, they are a G receiver in an N/AC world. Don't waste your money they can't connect at speeds in the world today, I have 250 Mb up and down, why would I want a 54 Mbps connecting to a 1300 Mbps connection. Sorry I read the hype, they are not worth the monies I understand now why they were so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Myhrer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a week
customer_reviews.text: One week into using it the usb-b cable would not make a good connection making the adapter useless I tried another cable and same issue. Seems the connection at the adapter somehow would not hold the cable tight
customer_reviews.author: Armando Marrero

customer_reviews.title: When this connected properly it gave download speeds on my ...
customer_reviews.text: When this connected properly it gave download speeds on my system of around 200 MBps. However, the connection was balky. Connected sometime, didn't connect other times. More importantly, it caused my system to crash sometimes. When it didn't crash my system, it degraded the performance.
customer_reviews.author: greenjob

customer_reviews.title: they're not updating their drivers
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use this since the entire time I've been WFH because they're not updating their drivers. It's basically garbage now.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Boosted a college campuses wifi!
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. I lived on a college campus and got some pretty crappy signals. This worked really well and provided better connections. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality and ease of use of this little guy, especially for the inexpensive price. I wasn’t expecting anything amazing, but it really is. I’m impressed. Also, the seller is friendly and responsive. So happy with my purchase 😊
customer_reviews.author: Caysey Douglas

customer_reviews.title: This product is cheapy priced and very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I have a tower computer and had it fixed for it got hit by lighting. I had bought another computer. So , when I got my other one fixed , I had nowhere to put it with internet connection. I put it in my garage, cause I spend a lot of time out there. I am an old guy in my 60's. I wasn't sure what to do. So, I bought this Wifi adapter. Which I was promptly delivered. I followed the instructions and was all hooked up and running within 5 minutes. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I never got this to work on any of my Mac systems. Each running an OS that, per the seller of this item should work with it. I downloaded the maker's drivers, none of them worked. Don't waste your money. Buy cheap, get cheap.
customer_reviews.author: BradHip

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product. Keep shopping.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Had issues with the drivers on the first install. The second one I am going to return because the dual connector will not stay connected. Sad I was hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Made my internet speed faster. I don't do gaming. Just regular internet browsing, video playing and downloading stuff etc. In several months I have not had any problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: RawKing

customer_reviews.title: Great product , simple to use
customer_reviews.text: The product works good . The box had both a disk and a thumb drive with the drivers . The half sized ( mini) disk did not work in my computer but the thumb drive worked just fine . Good speed , works great .
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: is it working?????
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are in very small print and .not complete. There are events that happen during install that are not covered. Like is the blue light suppose to flash or stay on. Also it s as us you will see the item in your wifi list. 3 tries at install. Never showed up on my wifi list. No idea if it is working, no error message No response from customer service
customer_reviews.author: DougNAME_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and useful wifi adapter
customer_reviews.text: I've used the wifi adapter for a few days now and I have no problems with it. It doesn't drop the signal, and it have great ping, download, and upload speeds. The distance between the adapter and the router is about 50 feet and there are 2 walls between them and it picks up the signal just fine. It is a good product and I recommend it for anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Booey

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Great Range
customer_reviews.text: Product came with a flash drive loaded with drivers and necessary software. Signal is really good even on the opposite end of my house. Have used for fps gaming a couple times now and zero latency issues or lag. At this price point, speed of delivery, performance, and ease of use I would certainly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Renesis Powered

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and a great value. The product is very well put together and should give me long life.
customer_reviews.author: ronworley

product_meta.title: EDUP WiFi Adapter AC1200Mbps 802.11ac Long Range Wireless Network Adapter Dual Band 5Ghz 2.4Ghz 6dBi Antenna for PC Windows XP,10,8.1,7,Vista, Mac OS 10.6-10.15
feature_bullets: The latest RTL8812BU chipest WIFI usb 1200Mbps Wi-Fi speeds on 5GHz (867Mbps) and 2. 4GHz (300Mbps) bands. 5GHz 867Mbps is perfect for HD video streaming and lag-free online gaming, 2. 4GHz 300Mbps Wi-Fi for normal use such as web surfing.
EDUP Wireless Adapter supports Windows XP, Win Vista, Win 7, Win8. 1, Win 10, Mac OS 10. 4 -10. 15 ( Not support Linux )

Super speed USB 3. 0 port: USB 3. 0 supports transfer rates of up to 10 times faster than USB 2. 0, ensures Wi-Fi adapter maximum throughput performance and more stable Internet connection. Backwards compatible with USB 2. 0 and 1. 1 devices.

Comes with 2 pieces of high gain long-range 6dBi antenna can help you connect even when signals are weak. The AC1200 Series is supported by all WLAN routers. Support WPA, WPA2 encryption and security authentication mechanism.
Wi-Fi USB AC1200Mbps lifetime . Easy to install, driver updates and full technical support in English. (Newest driver link in description or Contact us)
Wi-fi hot spot: you can create a hot spot with the soft AP feature if your computer is under wired internet connection. You can boost Wi-Fi to your mobile devices from your computer.
Warm Tip: If the U disk can not be used, please download the driver from EDUP site (( szedup.com/ep-ac1605gs-driver/ ))
Easy to Install & Service : 1) Install the driver ; 2) Plug it in ; 3) Go. Please make the Free Support call: 3232481976 , If you have any questions about the wifi adapter, thank you very much.
Warranty: One year manufacturer replacement warranty and 45 days no questions asked return policy
